meaning: To ask for humbly and earnestly, as by prayer.
To make a humble request or supplication, esp. in prayer.
To make a humble request of; petition earnestly.
sentences: I do not supplicate charity at your doors Nor do I belittle myself at the footsteps of your chamber So will you be angry?
It then was the duty of the latter to supplicate for his forgiveness, and administer to him the Eucharist.
No candidate who fails to pass the qualifying test will be permitted to supplicate for the degree.
Those who find a gospel in philosophy are ready to dictate terms to outsiders; but those who wait upon science for its verdicts supplicate terms of peace.
